Key Match Events: Egypt's goalkeeper Mohamed Abou Gabal struck the crossbar with his spot kick
Mostafa Mohamed equalized from the spot in first-half stoppage time
Mohamed Hamdy was sent off in the first period of extra time with his second yellow card for a late challenge on Simon Banza
In the shootout, Mohamed struck Egypt’s second penalty to the right of the goal, but Congo's Arthur Masuaku reciprocated by sending his effort over, and no other players missed until Abou Gabal did
Post-Match Reflections: Egypt's loss was due to the dislocated shoulder of Mohamed El Shenawy and the hamstring injury of Mohamed Salah during the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was heading for extra time when Ibrahim Diakité crossed for Boya to finally break the deadlock with a header inside the near post
Equatorial Guinea defender Federico Bikoro was shown a straight red card in the 55th for kicking Bayo while attempting a clearance
Others: DR Congo will next face Guinea
Guinea coach Kaba Diawara, who wiped away tears as he left the field and was applauded by journalists before the post-match news conference
The Stuttgart forward’s impact has been limited by a thigh injury sustained in a pre-tournament warmup
